text: (bright electronic music)
- Hi, my name is Shashi Kura.
I'm a software development manager

for a AWS service called
AWS Storage Gateway.

We offer hybrid cloud
storage for customers

who wants to use Amazon Cloud
Storage from on-premises.
I have been working for different startups

over the last 20 years
prior to joining Amazon.
I enjoyed working for smaller companies

where you could see the
impact that you are making.
I was hesitant to join Amazon not knowing,
being a big company, how it would be,
but it has been an amazing journey.

It still feels like I
work for a small startup,
but we have a big company name behind us.
And early in my career,
I did work for a large company,
and I knew the bureaucracy

and how it will slow down
the decision process.
But once I joined,

whatever I learned about
Amazon turned out to be true,
which is we are a fast-moving company
and we make decisions quickly.
Perhaps I'm biased,
I would say any friend who is interested

to work for a startup
or have that experience,
working at AWS is no different.
It is working for a startup.

If someone is interested to
learn how to build a service

that is going to be used by
thousands or millions of users,

there is no better place
than Amazon to build it.
